title: Savings
trackMonthlySavings: Track your monthly savings to visualize your progress.
autoCalculateDescription: Automatically update savings amount based on income and expenses (Income - Expenses)
disableAutoToEdit: Disable automatic calculation to edit manually
autoCalculatedValue: Value calculated automatically based on income and expenses (Income - Expenses)
noIncomeDataError: No monthly income data available for automatic calculation
detailedBreakdown: Detailed breakdown of your savings in

analysis.title: Savings Analysis
analysis.subtitle: Analyze your savings patterns and track your progress

strategies.title: Money-Saving Strategies
strategies.description: Personalized strategies to help you save more and reach your financial goals faster

strategyTitles.mealPlanning: Implement Meal Planning and Grocery Optimization
strategyTitles.energyEfficiency: Reduce Utility Costs Through Energy Efficiency

strategyDescriptions.budgetRule: Allocate 50% of income to needs, 30% to wants, and 20% to savings and debt payments.
strategyDescriptions.subscriptions: Review and cancel unused or unnecessary subscription services to reduce monthly expenses.
strategyDescriptions.emergencyFund: Create a dedicated savings fund covering 3-6 months of essential expenses for financial security.
strategyDescriptions.debtElimination: Focus on paying off high-interest debt to reduce interest payments and improve financial health.
strategyDescriptions.automatedSavings: Create automatic transfers to savings accounts on payday to ensure consistent savings before spending.
strategyDescriptions.mealPlanning: Reduce food expenses through strategic meal planning and smarter grocery shopping.
strategyDescriptions.energyEfficiency: Lower monthly utility bills by implementing energy-saving practices and upgrades.

timeFrames.immediate: Start today and see results within 1-2 weeks
timeFrames.shortTerm: Implement over 1-3 months for best results
timeFrames.longTerm: Build consistently over 6+ months for maximum impact
timeFrames.default: Timeline varies based on your situation

budgetRule: Use budgeting apps like YNAB or Mint to track expenses automatically
Review your budget weekly and adjust as needed
Start with the 80/20 rule and gradually work toward 50/30/20
subscriptions: Use apps like Truebill or Honey to find and cancel subscriptions
Set calendar reminders before free trial periods end
Consider annual subscriptions for services you definitely use - they're often cheaper
emergencyFund: Keep your emergency fund in a high-yield savings account
Aim for 3 months of expenses first, then build to 6 months
Don't invest emergency fund money - keep it liquid and safe
debtPayment: Use the debt avalanche method for mathematical optimization
Consider debt snowball method for psychological wins
Look into balance transfer cards for high-interest credit card debt
automatedSavings: Start with just 1% of income and increase gradually
Set up transfers for the day after payday
Use separate accounts for different savings goals
mealPlanning: Batch cook on weekends to save time and money
Shop seasonal produce and freeze extras
Use cashback credit cards for grocery purchases (if you pay them off monthly)
energyEfficiency: Unplug electronics when not in use - they draw power even when off
Use a smart thermostat to optimize heating/cooling schedules
Check if your utility company offers energy audits

adjustSavingsDescription: Adjust your savings amount for this month based on your income and expenses
